content.question: A student collects a sample of the blue dye from the column in a cuvette. Which of the following is least useful to determine the concentration of the sample using a spectrophotometer set at <math alttext="640 nanometers" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>640</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>n</mtext><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: The path length of the cuvette

The absorbance of the dye at <math alttext="640 nanometers" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>640</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>n</mtext><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

The molar absorptivity of the dye at <math alttext="640 nanometers" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>640</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>n</mtext><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Identify experimental procedures that are aligned to a scientific question (which may include a sketch of a lab setup).
